boat.name: Gipsy
boat.full_description:
Based on Mike Illingworth's research when he purchase 'Gypsy' in 1978, it appears she was owned at one time by two brothers named Thompson of Hull, one of whom was over 80 years old and living in Bridlington in 1961.

They sold 'Gypsy' to a Merchant Navy Captain and she was taken over by his son Mr. Albert Mason, a director of Beadles, a wholesale electrical supplier. He sold her to OGA member Mr. Peers for £200, who sold her to Richard Bernard in 1976 after she had suffered extensive damage to her stern. Following M. Illingworth's ownership, she was bought in January 1985 by R. A. Eberhard.

There is an aged photograph of 'Gipsy' in the Royal Yorkshire Yacht Club, Bridlington, taken in the 1924 regatta. The boat is clearly not new and has an elongated counter tapering off to a chisel edge. It seems 'Gipsy' has spent all her life on the East Coast and the best estimate of her construction date is 1895.

She was class II winner in the East Coast Old Gaffers Annual Race in 1974 and 1977.
boat.construction_details: Teak & pitch pine on oak. Clipper bow counter stern flush deck
boat.short_description: 'Gypsy' was built in Southampton by J. Ackett, probably in 1895. She has spent most of her life on the East Coast.
